mechanics.condition: Target is creature OR nonmagical object AND visible AND within range. If target is object, it must not be worn or carried.

mechanics.outcome: Spell has no effect on target.

mechanics.condition: Target creature is unwilling AND succeeds on a Wisdom saving throw
mechanics.outcome: Spell has no effect on target.

mechanics.condition: Spell is active and maintained via concentration
mechanics.outcome: Transformation lasts for the duration (up to 1 hour) OR until target drops to 0 hit points OR target dies.

mechanics.condition: Caster concentrated for the full duration
mechanics.outcome: Transformation becomes permanent and no longer requires concentration.

mechanics.condition: New form's Challenge Rating (CR) is greater than target's CR (or level, if target has no CR)

mechanics.outcome: Target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the new form's statistics. Target retains its alignment and personality.

mechanics.condition: Target transforms OR reverts to original form
mechanics.outcome: Target assumes the hit points of its new form. When reverting, returns to original hit points. If reverting due to 0 HP, excess damage carries over to normal form, potentially causing unconsciousness.

mechanics.trigger: Target performing an action (Creature into Creature)
mechanics.condition: Action requires hands or speech AND new form is not capable of such actions
mechanics.outcome: Target cannot perform the action (e.g., speak, cast spells).

mechanics.condition: Target has worn or carried gear
mechanics.outcome: Target's gear melds into the new form and cannot be activated, used, wielded, or benefited from.

mechanics.condition: New form's Challenge Rating (CR) is greater than 9 OR new form's size is larger than the original object's size

mechanics.outcome: The creature is friendly to the caster and companions, acts on the caster's turns, and the caster decides its actions and movement. The GM provides its statistics.
Caster no longer controls the creature. Its friendliness is dependent on how it was treated.

mechanics.condition: Target has worn or carried gear
mechanics.outcome: Target's worn and carried gear transforms along with the creature into the object form.
Target's statistics become those of the object.

mechanics.condition: Target reverts to normal form after being an object
mechanics.outcome: Target has no memory of time spent in object form.

description_text: Choose one creature or nonmagical object that you can see within range. You transform the creature into a different creature, the creature into an object, or the object into a creature (the object must be neither worn nor carried by another creature). The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the transformation becomes permanent.Shapechangers aren't affected by this spell. An unwilling creature can make a wisdom saving throw, and if it succeeds, it isn't affected by this spell.***Creature into Creature.*** If you turn a creature into another kind of creature, the new form can be any kind you choose whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or its level, if the target doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the new form. It retains its alignment and personality.The target assumes the hit points of its new form, and when it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked unconscious.The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech unless its new form is capable of such actions.The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.***Object into Creature.*** You can turn an object into any kind of creature, as long as the creature's size is no larger than the object's size and the creature's challenge rating is 9 or lower. The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It acts on each of your turns. You decide what action it takes and how it moves. The GM has the creature's statistics and resolves all of its actions and movement.If the spell becomes permanent, you no longer control the creature. It might remain friendly to you, depending on how you have treated it.***Creature into Object.*** If you turn a creature into an object, it transforms along with whatever it is wearing and carrying into that form. The creature's statistics become those of the object, and the creature has no memory of time spent in this form, after the spell ends and it returns to its normal form.
